p: Syphilis was first recognized in mainland China in 1505 [ 6]. In 1949, the country experienced one of the biggest syphilis epidemics in human history [ 6]. The prevalence was 84% in prostitutes compared to 5% in general population in metropolitan area, and 2â€“3% in less developed cities in the 1950s [ 6]. Chinese government lunched an unprecedented campaign to make syphilis eradicated in 1960s [ 7]. However, syphilis has revived in China since the reform and opening up, and the prevalence raised about 5% among FSWs and 3% among their male clients [ 1]. Most of previous studies were executed among high-risk groups such as FSWs, IDUs, men who have sex with men, while few studies were carried out in general population.
